SEARCH
Package com.bschoolland.services

Class StoreFront

java.lang.Object
com.bschoolland.services.StoreFront
public class StoreFront extends Object
Manages the store front inventory for the Game Item Shop. Provides functionality to initialize inventory, view products, purchase products, and return (cancel) purchases. The store is populated with hard-coded initial inventory consisting of weapons, armor, and health items.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Benjamin Schoolland

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    StoreFront()
    Constructs a new StoreFront and populates it with the initial hard-coded inventory of arena products.

  • Method Details

    • getInventory

      public List<SalableProduct> getInventory()
      Returns the list of all products currently in the store inventory.
      Returns:
      the list of salable products

    • displayProducts

      public void displayProducts()
      Displays all products in the store inventory to the console, numbered for easy selection.

    • purchaseProduct

      public boolean purchaseProduct(int index)
      Attempts to purchase a product by reducing its inventory quantity by one. Returns true if the purchase was successful, false if the product is out of stock.
      Parameters:
      index - the zero-based index of the product in the inventory list
      Returns:
      true if the purchase succeeded, false if out of stock

    • returnProduct

      public boolean returnProduct(int index)
      Cancels a purchase (returns a product) by increasing its inventory quantity by one.
      Parameters:
      index - the zero-based index of the product in the inventory list
      Returns:
      true if the return succeeded, false if the index is invalid

    • getInventorySize

      public int getInventorySize()
      Returns the number of products in the store inventory.
      Returns:
      the inventory size

    • getProduct

      public SalableProduct getProduct(int index)
      Returns the product at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the zero-based index of the product
      Returns:
      the SalableProduct at the given index, or null if invalid
